intro: Philotheca scabra subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved mountain geranium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring.
